dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Que Paso? [What happened?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anselma cayo en las rocas. Creo que  la pierna ha sido root--[Anselma  felt on the rocks. I think her leg's  broken--] Two men struggle forward supporting Anselma, trying to ho her leg out straight in front of her. She is in a lot of  pain--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No podemos alcanzar el camion llevando  a ella. Hay lugar para esconderla?  [We can't reach the truck if we're  carrying her. Is there somewhere to  hide her?] Enrique thinks, trying not to panic, as the others come u around him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conozco solamente una persona con  casa--[I only know one person with a  house--]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esta lejos? [Is it far?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes sits on her recliner, drink in hand. An old RECO plays from inside. She is startled by the voice from the  dark--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senora Cruz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Standing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quien es? [Who is it?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soy yo, Enrique! No tiene miedo--  [It's me, Enrique. Don't be afraid] Enrique steps out into the light. His pants are wet and h scared--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing out there? Are  you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hay pasado un accidente muy grave--  [There's been a bad accident--]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In English, Enrique. We're in the  United States--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some friends who have had a  accident--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have somebody else out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We was by the river? And I hear my  friend callin' for help, and I look  and she has falling in the water--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me lies, Enrique. Que  paso?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We was crossin' the river-- Nestor appears in the light now, supporting Anselma, who  hops awkwardly to move forward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enrique! Quienes son estos? How could  you bring them here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They need help. Jaime, Anselma--  esta es mi jefa--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senora--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call the Border Patrol, they'll  get her to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No puede hacer esto--[You can't  do that--]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're doing these people  a favor? What are they going to do?  Either they get on welfare or they  become criminals--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No es la verdad--[That isn't true--]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Con permiso, Senora, la muchacha  tiene mucho dolor--[Please, Senora,  the girl is in a lot of pain--] Mercedes grudgingly indicates the lounge chair--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sientase. [Sit.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Es muy amable. [You're very kind.] He and Enrique help Anselma into the chair. The Girl look up at Mercedes, frightened--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ayudanos, Senora, por favor no podemos  regresar--[Help us, Senora, please.  We can't go back] Mercedes looks at ANSELMA disapprovingly. The girl can't more than 14--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This girl is a friend of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Es mi novia. [She's my girlfriend.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were married!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am marry to the cousin of a friend-- but only to be able to live here.  This is the mother of my child--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This girl has a child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Scornful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tipico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stands at the front door of a house on the lake, bang on the door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis? You in there? Hollis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight kicks off the surface of the water.  We hear  SPLASHING, the frightened VOICE of a young woman--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donde esta? Estoy perdido--[Where  are you? I'm lost--]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aqui! [Here!] The girl flounders into the shot, wet and scared. Young  Mercedes, a teenager not unlike ANSELMA is wading thigh-d in the Rio, lost, scared--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No puedo ver la orilla! [I can't see  the bank!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aqui! Venga por aqui! [Over here!  Come this way!] Mercedes struggles toward the voice and suddenly a young becomes visible, standing in the water, holding his band for her, ELADIO--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vi a Rosaria arastrado para el   corriente--[I saw Rosaria taken away  by the current--]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No te molestas. Tenemos a ella. [Don't  worry. We've got her.] He takes her arm, pulls her toward the far shore--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Como se llama? [What's your name?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes Gonzales Ruiz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me llama Eladio Cruz--Bienvenido a  Tejas. [Welcome to Texas.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes is lost in thought as she recalls. She steps int the light by the carport. Enrique and Nestor are propping Anselma's leg up on pillows in the back of Mercedes' old  station wagon--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rapidamente! Everybody in the world  is going to see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donde vamos? [Where are we going?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A casa de Porfirio Zayas. He used to  be a doctor on the other side.   Gunshot wounds, fixing babies--if  you can pay he can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senora, anything it costs, I can  work--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. He owes me  some favors. Enrique turns to ANSELMA still frightened in the rear of station wagon--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seas tranquila, mija. (Nods to Mercedes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estamos en las manos de Senora Cruz.  [Just relax, honey. We're in the  hands of Senora Cruz.] Mercedes starts the car--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In English, Enrique. In English--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Del steps in. Chet sits at the table, drawing a cartoon i panels. Del looks over his shoulder for a moment--

dialogues.speaker: CARTOON
dialogues.text: A tank rolling over barbed wire, cannon and machine gun  blasting away--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homework?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finished that. I'm just messing  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanks, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to be in the Army, you might  as well have something slick to drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're going into the Army? Chet looks at him, not in a good mood, then goes back to drawing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the general plan, isn't it? Del watches for a long moment, thinking--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's up to you. Chet looks at his father again. All this is news to him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Army isn't for everybody. Chet can't quite believe he is hearing this. Del crosses the refrigerator--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I don't think you'd be good  at it, but--you know--I wouldn't be  disappointed if you decided to do  something else with your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Chet nods, begins to play again, considering the  possibilities. Del is making an effort and he doesn't hav much practice--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your room shaping up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'm pretty much moved in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. An awkward silence--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Tentative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to ever see your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He lives here, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. Del pulls some food out, watching Chet as he draws--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we'll clean that thing out  back up, have a barbecue next weekend.  We could invite him and his wife  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Chet flips the page of his sketchbook--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes his own sauce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neon's off, but there are a couple cars in the lot an light within. Sam pulls into the lot, steps out, approach the door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. The place is empty now except for Otis,  standing behind the bar, deep in conversation with Hollis sitting on a stool. Both swivel to look around guiltily a they hear Sam step in--

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Sam walks in slowly, crossing the floor to bring us back the two men--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not open. We were just talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis probably told you we found  Charley Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. How about that? People start  digging holes in this county, there's  no telling what'll come up. He sits a few stools away from Hollis--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two saw it, didn't you? You two  saw it when Buddy killed him. Hollis and 0tis look at each other--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imonna find out one way or the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father had the finest sense of  justice of any man I ever met--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and my mother was a saint. For  fifteen years the whole damn town  knew he had another woman on the  side. Stole ten thousand dollars to  set her up in business. But hell,  what's that? You got a problem?   Buddy'll fix it. Facing some time in  jail? Buddy'll knock half of it off-- if you do what he says, when he says.  You got some business that's not  exactly legal? Talk to Buddy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy Deeds--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy Deeds was a murderer. He looks at the two older men for a long moment--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night in the cafe--he didn't  stay long after you left, did he,  Hollis? Maybe he decided he'd gone  too far with Wade, maybe he figured  he better not wait for the Sheriff  to get behind him. So he stepped out  to see if he could catch up--and you  were here at the club that night,  weren't you, O? Otis sighs, begins to speak softly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was here.

dialogues.speaker: CU OTIS
dialogues.text: He turns to look toward the door as he reminisces, and we PAN away with his gaze--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd been running a game on the side  after hours craps, draw poker on the  weekends. Roderick didn't know about  it. More important, Charley Wade  didn't know about it, 'cause I didn't  want to cut him in. I suppose I'd  been drinking some, and I was pretty  full of myself in those days--but  hell, I just didn't expect the man  so early-- Sheriff Wade and Young Hollis step in the door and we are back in 1957. BLUES HARMONICA FADES UP, wailing from the  jukebox. They stop and look at the place--

dialogues.speaker: CLUB
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. The club is empty, dark. A LIGHT shines  from the back room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Smoke fills the air and Young Otis sits  back laughing, a large pile of money on the table in fron of him. The other four BLACK MEN at the table aren't doin so well. One by one they all look up past the camera to t door--

dialogues.speaker: CU OTIS
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Young Otis doesn't see at first, engaged dealing the cards. Finally, he senses the presence, looks

dialogues.speaker: WADE AND HOLLIS
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Wade stands over the table in the f.g.,  Young Hollis hanging back in the doorway. Wade is smiling his cold smile, cursing--

dialogues.speaker: CU YOUNG OTIS
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Trying to look unimpressed--

dialogues.speaker: EXTREME CU WADE'S EYES
dialogues.text: Cold and unblinking. MUSIC CONTINUES--

dialogues.speaker: EXTREME CU WADE'S MOUTH
dialogues.text: Twisted in a snarl as he curses. MUSIC CONTINUES--

dialogues.speaker: MEN, TABLE
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. We shoot past Wade's body as the other m step away from the table, grab their hats, and hurry out side door. Young Otis is left sitting at the table. Wade  starts walking toward him--

dialogues.speaker: CU YOUNG OTIS
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. His eyes following as Wade comes to stan over him--

dialogues.speaker: WADE, YOUNG OTIS
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Wade grabs the table and violently jerks over onto Young Otis, cards and money flying--

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG HOLLIS
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Watching squeamishly as Wade goes to wor on young Otis, the overhead light swinging wildly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Young Otis is hurled out of the back roo face bruised and bleeding. Wade follows, then Young Holli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade puts his gun next to Young Otis's ear, cursing at hi Young Otis gets to his feet, goes behind the bar--

dialogues.speaker: BAR COUNTER
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Young Otis slaps an envelope full of cas onto the counter--

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. He waves his pistol, indicating somethin behind Otis--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. We shoot past Wade at the counter as Oti turns and reaches for a cigar box on the shelf behind--

dialogues.speaker: CIGAR BOX
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Lying open, an old pistol inside of it.  Young Otis reaches--

dialogues.speaker: CU YOUNG HOLLIS
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Frowning as he senses something wrong--

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Wade levels his gun at Young Otis's back then turns to wink at Hollis like he did before he shot E

dialogues.speaker: WADE'S HAND
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Finger closing around the trigger of the

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Mouth open in horror--

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Eyes burning as he aims--

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Stepping in the door, seeing, CALLS OUT-

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG OTIS
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Turning to see Buddy--

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: BLAM! THWAP! A bullet plows through his neck, knocking hi back against the bar. MUSIC CONTINUES. His gun falls from his hand--

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG OTIS
dialogues.text: Horrified, splattered with the Sheriff's blood. MUSIC

dialogues.speaker: BAR COUNTER
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Twenty-dollar bills have spilled out of envelope and are soaking up blood--

dialogues.speaker: CU BUDDY
dialogues.text: Calm and hard-eyed. MUSIC CONTINUES. As he steps forward, see his pistol is still in its holster. He reaches out an takes the .45 from Young Hollis's shaking hand, looks him the eye till Hollis looks back, then looks toward Young O We PAN with his gaze to a CLOSE-UP of Otis, back in the  PRESENT. The MUSIC FADES--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Charley had some real big  friends in politics then, and if the  truth come out it wasn't going to go  easy on Hollis. (He shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why I trusted Buddy  with it--don't know why he trusted  me. The first time I ever talked  with him was right there, and then  with a dead white man leakin' blood  on the floor between us. He could  charm the scales off a rattler, Buddy  Deeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't what Sam was expecting. Hollis watches his fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of us cleaned up and took  him to the post and put him under.  Can't say I was much help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the ten thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Widow's benefits. He figured it would  make the disappearance look better,  and that Mexican gal was just scrapin'  by after Charley killed her man.  They didn't get hooked up till late--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time went on, people liked the story  that we told better than anything  the truth might have been. Sam swivels around on his seat to took at the spot where  Charley fell. He has a lot of information to deal with--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the call, Sam? Sam rolls it over in his mind before answering--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think the Rangers are likely  to find out any more than they   already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word gets out who that body was,  people are gonna think Buddy done  it. Sam gets up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy's a goddamn legend. He can  handle it. He heads for the door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Night, fellas. Hollis and Otis watch him go--

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: We see Sam sitting on the hood of his car parked in the  deserted drive-in lot, staring up at the ruined screen.  Pilar's car rolls in, parks beside him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilar gets out, kisses Sam, sits by him on the hood--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the picture start? Sam looks at her for a moment--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna tell your mother we been  seeing each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll figure it out sooner or later.  I don't have to ask permission  anymore, if that's what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have any idea when your father  died? Eladio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple months before I was born--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try a year and a half. He bands her  an old snapshot. PILAR looks at it--

dialogues.speaker: CU PHOTO
dialogues.text: Buddy and Young Mercedes on the lake. Buddy with his shir off on one end of a sailboat, Mercedes in a bathing suit, both smiling for the camera--

dialogues.speaker: SAM AND PILAR
dialogues.text: Pilar hands the photo back to him, tries to be calm--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen my mother in a   bathing suit before.  Didn't know  she owned one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy bought the cafe for her with  money he took from the county.     Pilar looks away, struggling not to  cry--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't pull this on me. It isn't  fair--I don't believe this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He paid the hospital bill when you  were born. Your mom always calls you  "our beautiful daughter" in the  letters she wrote to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the first time I saw you at  school--all those years we were  married to other people I always  felt like we were connected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember thinking you were the one  part of my life Buddy didn't have a  piece of-- A silence, both of them wondering what the next move shou be--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it? You're not going to  want to be with me anymore? Sam knows what he feels but doesn't have the words--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not having any more children.  After Amado, I had some complications--  I can't get pregnant again, if that's  what the rule is about--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I met you for the first time today,  I'd still want to be with you. It is what Pilar needed to hear--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start from scratch--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything that went before, all  that stuff, that history--the hell  with it, right? PILAR takes Sam's hand, kisses him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the Alamo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Pilar sit by each other holding hands, looking at the empty screen--
